intro: Tabernaemontana chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its striking, fragrant, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
